etymology.description: 電(電) (diàn, "electricity") + 話(話) (huà, "speech") forms 電話(電話) (diànhuà, "telephone"), which refers to the device for transmitting spoken communication through electric signals. 號(號) (hào, "number") + 碼(碼) (mǎ, "code") combine as 號碼(號碼) (hàomǎ, "number"), meaning a numerical identifier. Together, 電話(電話) (diànhuà, "telephone") + 號碼(號碼) (hàomǎ, "number") = 'telephone number'.
etymology.interpretation: A 電話(電話) (diànhuà, "telephone") is used for communication, and its 號碼(號碼) (hàomǎ, "number") is the unique sequence that identifies a particular phone line for dialing.
etymology.simplification: 電話號碼 is the same in simplified.

examples.chinese: 请给我你的电话号码(請給我你的電話號碼)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng gěi wǒ nǐ de diànhuà hàomǎ.
examples.english: Please give me your telephone number.

examples.chinese: 我忘记了电话号码(我忘記了電話號碼)，需要再确认(需要再確認)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ wàngjìle diànhuà hàomǎ, xūyào zài quèrèn.
examples.english: I forgot the telephone number, and I need to confirm it again.
